intro: [WRONG START] Maranta pohliiana, commonly known as the prayer plant, is a tropical flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves that fold upward at night, a behavior known as nyctinasty. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity. Maranta pohliiana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental foliage and ease of care.
